document.title: Revisions and Additions to the Illinois Social Science Standards

C9BB4EF982344D5C935AC4FD239AEEE1.description: Organize and critique applicable evidence to develop a coherent argument about the past.

AF3CBA31C05541BC8DB3A889ED67A7BD.description: Compare and contrast the central historical arguments in secondary works across multiple media.

FE908358717A48F4B4C90D67430F4D30.description: Describe the differences between correlation and causation in historical events and explain multiple causes and effects of historical events.

E6AD34F84D8B48BDAA56EAF024638F1B.description: Evaluate the validity of claims made in historical sources representing a variety of perspectives, describe the possible or actual impact(s) of the sources on audiences, and determine uses and applications.

679AC72259114E99A7693C145A1E6B4F.description: Detect possible biases and limitations in the historical record based on evidence collected from different kinds of historical sources by identifying the author, purpose, funding/source, type of publication/outlet, intended audience, etc.

BBB5D7B5FE034BA282CE8D0CAEF40BC3.description: Classify the kinds of historical sources used in a secondary interpretation to include sources representing multiple perspectives.

CB4F01ADB1C5402685E82393D816B259.description: Evaluate how perspectives of multiple individuals and groups have impacted the availability of information and the creation of historical sources.

2B77829B149F48BBB219EDC7B8901A05.description: Analyze and compare multiple factors that influenced the perspectives of multiple groups of people during different historical eras relevant to the cultural groups.

5F7AD65BD23F41D59CD3A888B160CDCB.description: Explain how and why perspectives of people have changed over time.

51EF3BE9240340CBA570A85E775DEFD0.description: Evaluate the significance of historical events to multiple groups and the relationship to modern-day movements and events.

51DD13BD7FFD490BA91DDE53A466D39B.description: Analyze connections and disconnections among events and developments in broader historical contexts and identify the effects of events on groups of people who have been marginalized.

1E6F35EC77F04F509CEF0A73EFFC6FE0.description: Identify and describe the contexts of a series of historical events and developments as examples of change and/or continuity based on the perspectives of multiple diverse groups.

3BFC28B7C6294E8D9ECEAC109CDC9E03.description: Analyze the relationship among financial risks and protection, insurance and costs.

4F9A248613D646E1AA0B9D552B534845.description: Describe the connection among credit, credit options, interest and credit history.

8A0F6E84AE7C45A08C68D0D0AB97BBCD.description: Explain the correlation among investors, investment options (and associated risks) and income/wealth.

C88BB01134564D8E856A839A3FDFF0AB.description: Identify how people choose to buy goods and services while still maintaining a budget based on income, taxes, savings, and fixed and variable expenses.

89C5AACF58DD4FC89793983B41905BAA.description: Explain the roles and relationships among savers, borrowers, interest, time and the purposes for saving.

63BAAD0A200B4681B1BFAB49ABD8AA3B.description: Analyze the relationship among skills, education, jobs and income.

18685B36BD1E448180AB30CE0E929478.description: Evaluate employment, unemployment, inflation, total production, income and economic growth data and how they affect different groups.

874EE9D6D91B417EAEEA9C77249B9B9F.description: Explain barriers to trade and how those barriers influence trade among nations.

B0013FE5C201436F97013917662ED65D.description: Explain why standards of living increase as productivity improves

600202D30E604E038E914DFBAA02873C.description: Explain how changes in supply and demand cause changes in prices and quantities of goods and services, labor, credit and foreign currencies.

1F2C6201031341B8BFB527EE4DAC1D6B.description: Describe the roles of institutions, such as corporations, non-profit organizations and labor unions, in a market economy.

4913DFAD670E4EADB0BFB0A25750AFB2.description: Analyze the role of innovation and entrepreneurship in a market economy.

00BCD71C5A894477A8245FC7DAB50931.description: Evaluate alternative approaches or solutions to current economic issues in terms of benefits and costs for different groups and society as a whole.

84FFAF4CA9CB4D18AED31261BC13CD8B.description: Explain how external benefits and costs influence choices.

1C33C2092A4143788597CBC34457786D.description: Explain how economic decisions affect the well-being of individuals, businesses and society.

77BB6D4177124474897925DCF661EC0C.description: Analyze how the environmental characteristics of places and production of goods influence patterns of world trade.

8B674266FFD04DDC95C9F66E08FBC214.description: Explain how global changes in population distribution patterns affect changes in land use.

8D381B10FF5E4658B278E37ACC344B2A.description: Identify how cultural and environmental characteristics vary among regions of the world.

C5591D98B6BD49278DEFBF9CDF9292AD.description: Evaluate the influences of long-term, human-induced environmental change on spatial patterns of conflict and cooperation.

C13695BEE08443A4A1E752D967E2CD6D.description: Explain how changes in transportation and communication influence the spatial connections among human settlements and affect the spread of ideas and culture.

912F2EA5C9114B008BD3005F0523D259.description: Explain how environmental characteristics affect human migration and settlement.

7082976DFE234621AA1EA3078161725B.description: Human Population: Spatial Patterns and Movements

2D2EEC04E753431088A90200DFFFE327.description: Evaluate how cultural and economic decisions influence environments and the daily lives of people in both nearby and distant places.

FD7908A83ECD4EEDBF8DD2E562CC6A20.description: Compare and contrast the cultural and environmental characteristics of different places or regions.

87CD636E61864D3890B9BE5FF833D266.description: Explain how humans and their environment affect one another.

F4FB0B2F9CAD424BACB1DA197662C30D.description: Human Environment Interaction: Place, Regions, and Culture

A38A240B817240E8BBFB3628A4CFBEBC.description: Construct different representations to explain the spatial patterns of cultural and environmental characteristics.

1ADBB0864347485789D156B707844A0E.description: Use mapping and graphing to represent and analyze spatial patterns of different environmental and cultural characteristics.

B23E90E13BFE44A2A1B9DA26E5F95ABB.description: Use geographic representations (e.g., maps, photographs, satellite images) to explain relationships between the locations (places and regions) and changes in their environment.

EA36C150769348589AD1BF159C6AA282.description: Geographic Representations: Spatial Views of the World

1030F4D7BCE04E7AB5351FF926353A6B.description: Develop and evaluate procedures for making decisions in historic and contemporary settings (e.g., school; civil society; or local, state or national governments).

E58F157316B442DAA0394E8F513FAA5C.description: Analyze the perspectives and positions of multiple individuals and communities impacted by specific rules and laws (both actual and proposed); the equitable application of rules and laws; and consequences for not abiding by rules and laws historic and contemporary settings.

5C444941D4AB47F4A98DC6FB6F8FC84D.description: Identify the impact of specific rules and laws (both those that are in effect and proposed) on multiple individuals and communities in relationship to the intended issues they were meant to address. Analyze cause-and-effect relationships of issues that initiated specific rules and laws.

F673B1BE17BD4CD6AD9832F621BA4223.description: Evaluate and critique deliberative processes surrounding the development and application of governing documents and policies and how they have changed over time.

A22AD4717012462FAC37A4BC62762B46.description: Analyze and synthesize ideas and principles contained in the founding and governing documents and practices of the United States, U.S. territories, and tribal nations within the United States.

4D90DA3AE59F49D189D601E905610857.description: Analyze the relationships among democratic principles, civic virtues, special interests, and perspectives to the ideas and principles contained in the constitutions, laws, treaties, and international agreements of the U.S. and other countries.

A5A954696EE24A6E8AFBB9341BB29037.description: Participation and Deliberation: Applying Civic Virtues and Democratic Principles

3B3DD69F67754795B6DA80B935DDED58.description: Explain how granting rights for individuals or communities does not reduce the ability of other individuals or communities to exercise the same rights and evaluate how efforts to maintain systems or initiate change within societies have worked for or against the benefit or oppression of multiple groups.

8848BEC281114E838FF6BE759E16E43D.description: Analyze the origins, purposes, and processes connected to maintaining or changing powers and how individuals and societies protect, grant, or deny rights.

E585FBC0B9CB4624B0BBB8CF839657B2.description: Identify the means used by individuals and groups to either maintain or change powers and protect, grant, or deny rights of individuals and communities in societies.

C904967EC0544D14B51FF53A7980CE07.description: Participation and Deliberation: Applying Civic Virtues and Democratic Principles

10BD8044B7D9422C997184872E750E7D.description: Synthesize how the changes over time in the application of laws and granting or denial of rights have impacted governments, public officials, and bureaucracies at different levels in the U.S., U.S. territories, and tribal nations within the United States.

0F6941E093774DE2B3E5CA1D553CB675.description: Analyze how the application of laws and the protection, granting, or denial of individual and collective rights have impacted participation and powers of various groups of people.

AF60073E467E4D8BAF40F2039889A6B8.description: Explain the origins, functions and structure of government with reference to the U.S. Constitution, Illinois Constitution and other systems of government and how they have impacted multiple groups of people.

E70D410BCF1948CCA33A3A0CD67B4C76.description: Describe the origins and purposes and impact of governing documents and policies (e.g., U.S. Constitution, Illinois Constitution, laws, treaties and international agreements) and synthesize their application and impacts on multiple groups of people with how they have changed over time.

AF7BB5184C234A6C800F3EC77BB2E52D.description: Evaluate the powers and responsibilities of individuals, political parties, interest groups and the media, how these have changed over time, and the impacts on multiple communities.

442EF2F9D03449BAAB48135FB1C016A4.description: Describe and analyze the roles of political, civil and economic organizations from a national to local scale in impacting multiple individuals and communities.

2241578096DF45BBBE59059E18B5595B.description: Identify different types of citizenship and immigration statuses of individuals in the United States and the different rights and roles (e.g., voters, jurors, taxpayers, military, protesters and officeholders) based on citizenship or immigration status.

3F7A478BFEDE485386BA135F7DC0A60C.description: Apply a range of deliberative and democratic procedures to make decisions and take action in schools and community contexts.

6370BDF079904C37886E457677E56181.description: Assess individual and collective capacities within a given context to take action, address problems, and identify potential outcomes.

9ABC6E78503844F68D0883D07A9FA378.description: Analyze how a problem can manifest itself, identify the individuals and communities impacted by a problem, and the challenges and opportunities faced by those trying to take action toward solutions.

B14A4C22FED248CBBB19D33A4118FCEC.description: Critique the structure and credibility of arguments and explanations (self and others) about a topic.

434F577571E448C99242B1C79C87A344.description: Present arguments and explanations that would appeal to audiences and venues outside of the classroom, using a variety of media.

35BC2C2B593F4E8D8E7E9A73B0CC7A81.description: Construct arguments using claims and evidence from multiple sources, while acknowledging the arguments' strengths and limitations.

B18B8576588D41BCB0AED71451CAC7DE.description: Construct explanations for a specific audience using reasoning, correct sequences, examples, and details, while acknowledging their strengths and weaknesses.

0154AB80C16C41E5B8E601551D54DBE0.description: Communicating Conclusions and Taking Informed Action

F27FB1A3FC0145F2AE8E3EFBF46433F7.description: Develop claims and counterclaims using evidence from credible sources while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both.

61F371C15C384080811715543CAB4D55.description: Identify evidence from multiple sources to support claims, noting any limitations of the evidence.

7C488CAEA2654253B7CD01A776A1597E.description: Appropriately cite all the sources used.

D32049DACFC34FA4874BAE7B335055A3.description: Gather relevant information from credible sources and determine whether they support each other.

8F3807DCB0AE44F6A8A093A04E1FE353.description: Determine the credibility of sources based upon their origin, authority and context.

9AB63285C4BB4076BE692A7923FEAAFF.description: Determine the value of sources by evaluating their relevance and intended use.

24CE088486DB43FD96BFA8DE0DBD1DCB.description: Determine sources representing multiple points of view and diversity of authorship that will assist in organizing a research plan.

EDE87D4F3C0B4BFCAFBBC4335FFE461B.description: Ask essential and focusing questions that consider multiple perspectives and will lead to independent research.

1779BA7B456344FB969947726DB8C219.description: Create essential questions to help guide inquiry about a topic that consider multiple perspectives.
